intro: Dyschoriste amoena, commonly known as the pink-flowered dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and usually oval in shape, with a smooth surface. Dyschoriste amoena is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
